message_1: Identify the number of possible stereoisomers for a molecule with the molecular formula C5H10O that contains one chiral carbon. Draw all the possible structures indicating their configurations as R or S.
message_2:
For a molecule with one chiral carbon, there can be two possible stereoisomers: one with the R configuration and one with the S configuration. Here are the possible structures for a molecule with the molecular formula C5H10O containing one chiral carbon:

1. 2-pentanol:
   Chiral carbon is at position 2.
   R-2-pentanol: H-C(=O)-C(R)-C-C-C
   S-2-pentanol: H-C(=O)-C(S)-C-C-C

2. 3-methyl-2-butanol:
   Chiral carbon is at position 3.
   R-3-methyl-2-butanol: H-C(=O)-C-C(R)-C-C
   S-3-methyl-2-butanol: H-C(=O)-C-C(S)-C-C

In total, there are four possible stereoisomers for a molecule with the molecular formula C5H10O that contains one chiral carbon.
